ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic triad of intellectual disability, microcephaly, and growth retardation (short stature) with early onset. NIPBL mutations cause the most common form.
Characterized by severe microcephaly, intellectual disability, and proportionate short stature. Primary microcephaly with dwarfism presentation fits well.
Progressive disorder with microcephaly, intellectual disability, and growth failure. More common in females, which matches patient gender.
Features intellectual disability, microcephaly, and growth retardation. CREBBP mutations cause this form, though typically has additional dysmorphic features.
Presents with severe intellectual disability, microcephaly, and growth delay. Typically has additional features like seizures and ataxia not mentioned here.
Intellectual disability with microcephaly and growth retardation are core features. ARID1B mutations are most common cause.
Metabolic disorder with intellectual disability, microcephaly, and growth retardation. Usually has additional malformations not described here.
Features microcephaly and severe growth retardation with variable intellectual disability. ORC1 mutations cause this form.
